kickstart.post:
ID=`/bin/egrep -i "^lmwriter" /etc/group` if [ "$ID" == "" ] ; then # adding lmwriter user with group /usr/sbin/useradd -c "Lifemapper user" lmwriter else # adding lmwriter user, group already exists /usr/sbin/useradd -c "Lifemapper user" -g lmwriter lmwriter fi /opt/rocks/bin/rocks sync users
# FE directory NOT exported to /share /bin/mkdir -p /state/partition1/lmscratch/run /bin/mkdir -p /state/partition1/lmscratch/worker /bin/chgrp -R lmwriter /state/partition1/lmscratch /bin/chmod -R 775 /state/partition1/lmscratch
# FE directory exported to /share /bin/mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm /bin/mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/data/testlayer /bin/mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/data/layers/retrieved /bin/mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/metrics /bin/mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/sge /bin/chgrp -R lmwriter /state/partition1/lm /bin/chmod -R 775 /state/partition1/lm
# these commands do the same changes as lifemapper-server roll # need if both rolls are on the same server /bin/chgrp lmwriter /opt/lifemapper /bin/chmod 775 /opt/lifemapper
for item in "config" "Lm*" "__init__.py*" ; do /bin/chgrp -R lmwriter /opt/lifemapper/$item /bin/chmod -R 775 /opt/lifemapper/$item done
# Mounts /export/lm to /share/lm
lm &Kickstart_PrivateHostname;:/export/&
/etc/init.d/autofs restart /opt/rocks/bin/rocks run host compute "service autofs restart"
# Catalogs environmental layers for computations /opt/lifemapper/rocks/bin/seedData
